Articles.Content:
It's a Duna plane.

What more can be said?
Well i agree fully, it is a plane, and its by duna.

Is the landing part actually one frame per second or so, or is youtube being stupid for me?

Also, are you aware that airbreathing engines only work on Kerbin and Laythe?

Aside from that, well played on getting such a plane to Duna!

Is the landing part actually one frame per second or so, or is youtube being stupid for me?

Also, are you aware that airbreathing engines only work on Kerbin and Laythe?

Aside from that, well played on getting such a plane to Duna!

The beginning was screenshots, not video.

Yes I knew that the engines only work on kerbin and laythe.

This plane was a versatile glider, used for more than duna.

It's next stop...

MOHO.
Moho's atmosphere is barely tangible, so I bid you good luck! I want to see this.
Cool design for the plane, and I would like to see what beast lugged it into orbit.

Cool design for the plane, and I would like to see what beast lugged it into orbit.

Sadly, I didn't. I used Debug Screen and SSTO'ed it there. Am working on a legit launcher now.
Nice frontflip. How did you discover that?

Nice, I haven't tried a plane on Duna yet.

Whats that music on the second part?
technically, if the engines don't do anything it is powerless, therefore it is a glider, not a plane
May I ask what those blue front bumper parts are ?

Nice frontflip. How did you discover that?

I ran up to the fuselage, planning to jump over, but instead I front flipped

Nice, I haven't tried a plane on Duna yet.

Whats that music on the second part?

There was only one song, Queen of the Night By MachinimaSound.com

technically, if the engines don't do anything it is powerless, therefore it is a glider, not a plane

There were radial engines on the wings without them, the plane would have crashed into a hill on landing.

May I ask what those blue front bumper parts are ?

Zoxygene mod. I used them to balance the planes weight out.

Moderator Comment: Please refrain from posting multiple times in a row, thanks. - Ted

Edited October 13, 2012 by Ted
Multiple posts
